skillTree.localised_description: While Wizards can rarely benefit from amour, a warhorse does offer some degree of protection and manoeuvrability.
A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.
Gelt has appeared on many battlefields soaring overhead on his pegasus.
No one is more accomplished in the Lore of Metal than the golden-masked Gelt.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Metal spells
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Lore of Metal spells

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Gelt's mask of gold both covers up the results of the explosion that almost ended his life and affords considerable protection to its wearer in battle.
Gelt's command of magic is so strong that he is able to improve the armour of his entire force by alchemical means.
What ingenious technological advance is this, that affords Imperial artillerists more and better ammunition with which to smite Karl Franz's enemies?

effects.description:
Missile strength: +20% for Pistoliers, Free Company Militia, Outriders and Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Pistoliers, Free Company Militia, Outriders and Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Gelt's modifications of the Emperor's special weapons - giving them twice the power than previously thought possible - has increased their effectiveness and resistance to attack.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +20% for Luminark and Steam Tank units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Possessed of a fierce intelligence and remarkable magical skills, the youngest Wizard ever to become Patriarch of the Gold College is known - and feared - throughout the land.

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -20% for Wizards
	(all characters factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: There is no one known to possess greater knowledge in alchemical matters than Balthasar Gelt, so great is his understanding of the mystical Lore of Metal.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
“We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the Warrior Priests, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -3% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -8% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for all units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The Wind of Chamon will rise and blast any who get in my way!"

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for Lore of Metal

Missile strength: +10% for artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Battle Wizards
	(factionwide)

items.colour_text: This mystic robe creates a shimmering series of images that match and refract Gelt’s appearance to confuse and befuddle any attacking foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Glittering Robe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Glittering Robe Upgraded"

items.colour_text: This ancient Elven heirloom glows with protective energies that become increasingly more powerful in the presence of evil sorcery.
The Staff of Volans has ever been the symbol of the Supreme Patriarch's office, allowing Gelt to bend the Winds of Magic to his will.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Battle Wizards
	(local province)
